Ena Kovac

Hello World! I'm a Computer Science student at Cornell with a minor in Artificial Intelligence. My work focuses on backend engineering and applied machine learning, including large-scale systems at Amazon Web Services and automation and NLP projects at Samsung SDS and American Express. I enjoy building reliable, data-driven systems and machine learning models that perform in real-world settings.

My last projects </>

WebSocket Management Service (AWS)
INFRA

Designed and validated a WebSocket management service on AWS ECS handling 6K+ concurrent connections and 8MB payloads; implemented scalable throttling and persistence mechanisms and conducted large-scale load testing.

AWS WebSockets ECS

MCP Server for Automation (AWS)
AUTOMATION

Built an MCP server integrating 38 APIs for natural-language automation, reducing manual UI interaction time by ~30% and enabling reproducible automated workflows for product teams.

AWS Automation NLP

Database Development (Java)

Architected and deployed a SQL database managing 100K+ records and optimized query performance for three core models; implemented a dynamic query plan builder to select algorithms based on dataset size, improving retrieval efficiency by ~40%.

Java SQL PostgreSQL

Emotion Classification Model (NLP)
ML

Engineered an NLP pipeline and deep-learning model on a 50K-sample dataset, combining GloVe, BiLSTM, Attention, CNN layers and XGBoost to reach 95% accuracy across 20+ emotion classes.

Python Keras NLP

Distributed Messaging System (OCaml)

Built a distributed chat system supporting 1,000+ concurrent clients with asynchronous messaging and optimized routing; achieved <500ms latency and 99% delivery by tuning concurrency and socket-based routing.

OCaml Sockets Distributed
